item.title: Skillcape help
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“newservermaker, post:10, topic:153484”]Heres a mini TUT:

search for:

int CLRanged = GetCLRanged(wearID);

and lets say you want to add in slayer, you would add this right under it:

int CLSlayer = GetCLSlayer(wearID);

if you wanted a different skill, change Slayer to the skill name, case sensitive.

now search for:

CLRanged one time and add:

[code]if (playerLevel[playerSlayer] - CLSlayer < 0) {
sendMessage("You need " + CLSlayer + " " +

statName[playerRanged] + " to equip this item.");
GoFalse = true;
}[/code] after the last }

Now you need to search for:

public int GetWorld(int playerId) {

Once you have found that, lets say for slayer agein, you would want to add this DIRECTLY above it:

[code]public int GetCLSlayer(int ItemID) {
if (ItemID == -1) {
return 1;
}
String ItemName = GetItemName(ItemID);
if (ItemName.startsWith(“ITEM NAME HERE”)) {
return ##;
}
}

[/code]

hope it helped

if you get any errors, ask me and ill help you, well… ill help you through it all lol[/quote]

Omfg… I actually said that. ARGH OMFG. U nub

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcape help
item.dc:creator: @newservermaker newservermaker
item.description:
@newservermaker wrote:

Heres a mini TUT:

search for:

int CLRanged = GetCLRanged(wearID);

and lets say you want to add in slayer, you would add this right under it:

int CLSlayer = GetCLSlayer(wearID);

if you wanted a different skill, change Slayer to the skill name, case sensitive.

now search for:

CLRanged one time and add:

[code]if (playerLevel[playerSlayer] - CLSlayer < 0) {
sendMessage("You need " + CLSlayer + " " +

statName[playerRanged] + " to equip this item.");
GoFalse = true;
}[/code] after the last }

Now you need to search for:

public int GetWorld(int playerId) {

Once you have found that, lets say for slayer agein, you would want to add this DIRECTLY above it:

[code]public int GetCLSlayer(int ItemID) {
if (ItemID == -1) {
return 1;
}
String ItemName = GetItemName(ItemID);
if (ItemName.startsWith(“ITEM NAME HERE”)) {
return ##;
}
}

[/code]

hope it helped

if you get any errors, ask me and ill help you, well… ill help you through it all lol

item.title: Skillcape help
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Make another method is what i did.
Firstly you have to look for clstrength. And you will see some ints n stuff, copy them, and rename to the skill you want. Here is example of mine

int CLHerblore = GetCLHerblore(wearID);
if (CLHerblore > playerLevel[playerHerblore]) {
				sendMessage("You need " + CLHerblore + " " + statName[playerHerblore] + " to equip this item.");
				GoFalse = true;
			}
	public int GetCLHerblore(int ItemID) {
	String ItemName = GetItemName(ItemID);
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("_", " ");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("platebody", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("platelegs", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("shield", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("kiteshield", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("helm", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("boots", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("plate", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("legs", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("thrownaxe", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("knife", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("javelin", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("dart", "False");
	ItemName = ItemName.replaceAll("Dragonhide", "False");

	if (!(ItemName.contains("False"))) {

        if (ItemName.contains("Herblore")) {
        return 99;
        }
	else
	return 1;
	}
	else
	return 1;
	}

Yours will be different, hav a nise day

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcape help
item.dc:creator: @chris13 chris13
item.description:
@chris13 wrote:

On the attack, strength, mage, range and defence skillcape i have made it so u need the 99 to wear it and this is the code for strenght cape that i have…

public int GetCLStrength(int ItemID) { if (ItemID == 10708) { return 99; } String ItemName = GetItemName(ItemID); if (ItemName.startsWith("Combat Cape")) { return 99; } else if (ItemName.startsWith("Torags hammers") || ItemName.endsWith("Dharoks greataxe")) { return 70; } return 1;

and the “if (ItemID ==10708) {” makes it so u need the 99 for the cape…How would i do it for the other capes…
could u post an example or something? plzzzzzz

thx

Read full topic
